member.name: T:StyleCop.Diagnostics.SensitiveDataAttribute
member.summary: Marks an item as either containing or handing sensitive data which should be obscured in trace output.

remarks.para: This attribute may be applied to parameters or return values of methods to indicate that they contain sensitive data and should be obscured in the trace output. Alternatively entire properties, methods or constructors may be marked with this attribute and any input or output will be obscured from the trace. Note that this attribute only has an effect on the method which takes a parameter array, and the methods that take a parameter array or return value.

Note that in DEBUG builds when the trace flag is used, the sensitive data can be printed out without being obscured which is useful for debugging. This flag is ignored in RELEASE builds to ensure that sensitive data cannot be traced on production systems.

member.remarks: This is a replacement for the default class. This class publishes the as an rather than as an as with the default implementation. This allows us to use any value for the tracing level rather than the restricted 5 values of the default class.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the analyzer should cancel its analysis and return immediately.
member.remarks: The analyzer should check the value of this property periodically while analyzing a document. If the value is set to true, the analyzer should immediately stop analyzing the document and return.

member.summary: Parses a source code document.
member.param: The parsed representation of the file.
member.returns: Returns false if no further analysis should be done on this file.
member.remarks: If this method returns false, StyleCop will call the method again on the next pass and send in the same file, list of analyzers, and document. This allows the parser to perform to parse its files in stages, if necessary.

member.name: M:StyleCop.SourceParser.ClearAnalyzerTags(StyleCop.CodeDocument)
member.summary: Clears the analyzer tags for the given document and all of its children.

remarks.para: During each analysis run, analyzers can store data within each analyzed document for later use. Analyzers store and retrieve this data using the and methods.

After all analysis has been completed, this analyzer data should be cleared so that it will not conflict with the next analysis. This method can be called to clear all analyzer data which was stored during the previous analysis.
